comment._content: lovelly old photos one day i might get to see them

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/81629894@N02] Hi there - we will be sharing some more of the McKilliam collection on Flickr so keep an eye out! Some of the McKilliam collection is on eMuseum (you can search by name) not many have images but they do have descriptions: emuseum.anmm.gov.au/code/emuseum.asp. Hope that helps :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I wonder why ploughing never took off as a modern sport? It's way more interesting than cricket and unlike footy, it doesn't give you brain damage. Probably make a mess of the running track if they held it at the Olympics though. Ploughing match tragics might like to know that over at the PHM they have some wonderful pics taken at interstate ploughing matches held in the early 20th century, eg. www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2448018608/

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Ooh thanks for making the connection to PHMuseum images (and the google news article of 1907). Perhaps we will be converted to Ploughing match tragics here at the ANMM? Favourite event? I like the sound of the 'Double Furrow Plough Contest' :P
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
